resources.string:
You are running version %1$s.

I hope you like it (and rate highly it in the Play Store, if you would). I\'m interested in hearing if you were surprised by anything while using the app. That could mean you were thinking "I wish I could…", or sometimes means you thought it should work differently or maybe work at all!

When you report, please include the phone hardware type (ie Samsung xyz) you\'re running on, as much detail as you can (what you were doing at the time), the version number above, and if not obvious, what about it that was \'unexpected\'. Thanks! knurder.frog4food@recursor.net or www.facebook.com/ufoknurder

It looks like you have scanned the Touchless menu and have quick access to untappd.

Since this app is unofficial, I don\'t know what the URL\'s are for all stores. If you\'d like to help out other patrons of The %1$s, you could share the URL via email with me, then I could build it into the app so the QR code scan would become unnecessary.

knurder.frog4food@recursor.net or www.facebook.com/ufoknurder

This version of Knurder lets you pop over to \"Untappd\" to check-in your beer, or just see what members there are saying about the beer.

To open up Untappd, drill into a beer\'s detail page, if you see a price there, you can long press the beer name.

The Saucer has listed it\'s beers on \"Untappd\". You get the ability to see price, glass size, and to be able to check-in your beer, or just see what people are saying about the beer. Just drill into a beer\'s detail page, then long press the beer name.
"Take a Picture and Label Your Beer"

Do you want to paste this beer description onto a picture of your beer?

You select the kind of glassware you\'ll be taking a picture of, take a picture, position the description, and then you can save or share the labeled photo.

If you\'re a UFO member, by default, your ratings will be saved to the Saucer site next time you update your \'tasted\' list. Once saved there, they are no longer editable.

You can go into Knurder settings and set it so it does not upload, if you\'d like.

But if you decide not to upload (or if you are not a UFO member), then the ratings are ONLY on your phone, so could be lost if you get a new phone.

I just wanted to be sure you knew the deal.

You can move, rotate, enlarge, change the geometry, and change the color of the description text so that it looks like the description is actually pasted onto your beer glass.

There are probably many combinations of glass shape and camera angle that just don\'t work, so if you\'d like to help make the app better, please find \'ufoknurder\' on FaceBook and share your experience or email me since I might be able to get your situation working better in a future release.
When you\'re looking at any list, you can shake your phone and a random beer will be selected for you!

If you\'d like, you can send this list to \`Brews-On-Queue\`.

They\'ve got it set up to require a separate authentication:
[card number / pin].
If you don\'t have that set-up, you can go to www.beerknurd.com/tapthatapp/, and the pin you use will become your pin.

If you know your credentials, just hit the three dots menu (above) and select \'Send to Brews on Queue\'

If you\'d like, you can send this list to \`Brews-On-Queue\`.

It looks like you have the
[card number / pin] credentials set already so just hit the three dots menu (above) and select \'Send to Brews on Queue\'

For authentication issues, get it working on your web browser first at www.beerknurd.com/tapthatapp/

You scan the QR code that the Saucer has put on the tables. Knurder then knows where to go to get your Saucer\'s tap lineup details! It\'s probably not going to be 100% perfect because the menu names aren\'t exactly the same as the web names and the beers in the menu might not align perfectly with the tap wall.

If we successfully get menu information now, you\'ll have the opportunity to set it so you pull the menu data automatically in the future.
Long press the description text, and you can flag/unflag this beer. If you see a price, then a long press on the beer name will take you to this beer in Untappd.
"Aim at a Column and Hold Still"

You can\'t scan the entire menu at once, so get just one \'column\' on your screen (portrait orientation) and hold it there for a few seconds.

You should see text appear on the screen. If you see a nice looking price along with a slash and a nice looking glass size paired with a reasonably accurate stab at the beer name, then that beer is probably captured, if that beer is on the tap wall.

Once you get a few good screens-full of text, you can move to another location, then hold it there for another 10 seconds or so. To go through the whole menu will take a minute or two if you want to capture as much as possible.

Don\'t try to scan bottles and cans, it\'s only pulling from taps.

Use what you see to gauge your scanning technique. You might need to aim slightly from the side if you\'re getting a reflection. If you don\'t need the light, click the light bulb in the upper right before you start your scanning.
"Cover Your Cans, Aim and Hold Still"

You can scan the entire \'new arrivals\' sheet at one time. Aim your phone, portrait orientation, and hold it still for a few seconds. Wait until the screen shows recognizable names and prices.

One minor thing is since the new arrivals sheet has a bottles and cans section, that can be picked-up if here\'s a tap with the same name. You can put your hand over that section if you\'re so inclined.

My new arrivals sheet doesn\'t have glass size, so we\'re only picking up the price. If you see a nice looking price along with a reasonably accurate stab at the beer name, then that beer is probably captured (if that beer is still available on the tap wall and reflected as such on the web site).

Once you get a few good screens-full of text, you\'re done.

I have no clue as to the format of the \'new arrivals\' sheet at your Saucer, so if it doesn\'t work, find \'ufoknurder\' on Facebook or hit me up via the email address from the application\'s \'About\' page.
"Point Your Camera Towards the Touchless Menu QR Code"

If you see a QR code on your table at your Saucer, you can point your phone at it, and this app might be able to grab that menu and pull off the glass sizes and prices for tap beers.

I can only test at my Saucer, so if it doesn\'t work, find \'ufoknurder\' on Facebook or hit me up via the email address from the application\'s \'About\' page.
Display dark page backgrounds with light lettering rather than white page backgrounds
Save the password locally for convenience at the minor cost of being less secure
Save the PIN locally for convenience at the minor cost of being less secure
Hide the legacy beer list buttons, leaving only the icon-based list button.
Show only tasted on your current plate, not from older plates.
Show the camera icon so you can paste beer descriptions on photos and also use the camera to scan the menu.
Post the reviews you type in here to the UFO site. They are NOT EDITABLE after posting!
Do not show the button that takes you to the food delivery web page.
Retrieve prices and glass sizes every time the beer list is refreshed. Requires scanning the Touchless QR code on the table at the restaurant.
Reset help screen preferences so they show up again.
Sign in to get your tasted list
Could not authenticate. Please confirm logon by going to the UFO web site.
"Contacts permissions are needed for providing cardno completions."
Not able to connect to a network.
Not able to connect to the Internet.
%1$s menu items added or updated this time
This app will instruct your camera app to save in a new \'Knurder\' photo album contained in external storage. That\'s all we do, just put photos in the Knurder album.

This app will instruct your camera app to save pictures in the \'Knurder\' photo album (under Files > Images). If your camera app wants/needs location, that\'s all them; I don\'t use location. We save beer pictures. That\'s all we do.
Access to the camera is needed to scan the Saucer menu.
Sorry, we can\'t scan because it looks like we don\'t have access to the camera.
Ocr dependencies cannot be downloaded due to low device storage
Enter the PIN associated with the UFO card
